intro: Staurogyne singularis var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicellate staurogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in wetland and aquatic environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers with showy, pinkish-white petals. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in water gardens and as a decorative plant in humid indoor settings.
